thread.title: "The Martian" soars to top box office spot
thread.title_full: "The Martian" soars to top box office spot

title: "The Martian" soars to top box office spot
text:
"The Martian" soars to top box office spot 12:53am BST - 01:09 
Big-budget fantasy ''Pan'' flops in its dismal debut, but ''The Martian'' retains its popularity leading the box office for a second weekend in a row. Gavino Garay reports.   
Space thriller "The Martian" is keeping the movies in business holding over its lead for the second weekend in a row at the U.S. box office pulling in $37 million. That brings its total sales to a whopping $108.7 million. And another strong holdover from last weekend, "Hotel Transylvania 2" that showed impressive stamina after raking in $20.3 million in its third weekend. Meanwhile, quite the misfire critics are saying of Warner Bros' big-budget fantasy "Pan." It cost some $150 million to bring Never-Neverland to life... to later bring in a dismal $15.5 million in its opening week, according to studio estimates. With that, film commentators say we won't be seeing more Peter Pan anytime soon.  //reut.rs/1MmTYyp
